thread.title: Lady Hounds threaten Colonial Division leaders
thread.title_full: Lady Hounds threaten Colonial Division leaders

author: ANDREW MILLER Sports Writer
title: Lady Hounds threaten Colonial Division leaders
text:
PHOTOS BY MICKEY NYE Pletcher 
Ship goalkeeper Hannah Pletcher and defender Kaila Ocker scramble to try and stop a Waynesboro attempt on goal in the rain Tuesday evening. Ashlee Rowles 
Ashlee Rowles wins the ball despite a Waynesboro challenge in the Greyhounds’ 2-1 loss at Shippensburg Memorial Park. Posted: Friday, October 2, 2015 6:00 am Lady Hounds threaten Colonial Division leaders By ANDREW MILLER Sports Writer ShipNC.com | 0 comments 
The Lady Greyhound soccer team put a scare into Mid Penn Colonial Division leaders Waynesboro with a game performance Tuesday afternoon at Shippensburg Memorial Park. 
The Greyhounds struck first, as Shippensburg’s Natalie Nye collected a goal through the steady raindrops in the 32nd minute of the match.
